intro: Lawia ceylanica var. gardneriana, commonly known as the Ceylon lawia, is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
